Habit Streak Tracker
- Single-file Python 3 script using only standard library (json, os, datetime, shutil).
- Console-based app for tracking daily habits with streak counters; data persists in 'habits.json'.
- Main menu: 1) List habits, 2) Add habit, 3) Mark complete (today), 4) Edit habit name, 5) Delete habit, 6) Undo/redo last action, 7) Export JSON, 8) Import JSON, 9) Quit.
- Habits stored as list of dicts: {'name': str, 'streak': int, 'last_completed': str (YYYY-MM-DD)}.
- On startup, load from 'habits.json' if exists; auto-save after every change.
- List habits sorted by streak descending; show name, current streak, days since last completion (or "Today" if recent).
- Add habit: prompt for name, streak=0, last_completed=None.
- Mark complete: select habit by number, set last_completed=today's date, increment streak if yesterday or earlier.
- Edit/Delete: select by number, confirm before delete.
- Undo/Redo: maintain stack of up to 10 actions (add/edit/delete/mark); undo reverts last action, redo reapplies.
- Export: copy 'habits.json' to user-specified filename.
- Import: load from user-specified JSON file, merge/overwrite with confirmation.
- Use colored output with ANSI escapes for status (green=active streak, red=broken).
- Keyboard shortcuts in menu: support 'u' for undo, 'r' for redo, arrow keys for navigation (use simple input loop).
- Validate dates with datetime; handle invalid JSON gracefully.
- Testable: add 3 habits, mark one complete 2 days, undo, verify streak/list; import/export roundtrip.
